TEXT.TITLE: AUSTRALIA SELLS BONDS IN TWO TRANCHES
TEXT.BODY: The Commonwealth of Australia is offering in the Yankee bond market 400 mln dlrs of bonds in two tranches, said lead manager Morgan Stanley and Co Inc. A 250 mln dlr issue of bonds due 1997 was given a 7-5/8 pct coupon and was priced at 99.25 to yield 7.73 pct, or 60.5 basis points more than comparable Treasury securities. A companion 150 mln dlr offering of 30-year bonds was given an 8-3/8 pct coupon and was priced at 99.875 to yield 8.386 pct, or 82.5 basis points over Treasuries. Both tranches are non-callable for life. Moody's rates the bonds Aa-1 and S and P rates them AA-plus. Reuter
